skills.task_description: Concatenate all .MF4 files in the folder C:\Users\ADMIN\Downloads\ev-data-pack-v10\ev-data-pack-v10\electric_cars\log_files\Kia EV6\LOG\2F6913DB\00001026\.Save the concatenated file as Kia_EV_6_2F6913DB.mf4 in the same folder.

action_plan.reasoning: Bring asammdf to the foreground so subsequent UI actions target the correct application.
Capture current UI elements before interacting (required by workflow).
Open the Mode menu to switch application mode to Batch processing (per KB: set_mode_batch_processing).
After opening Mode menu, capture UI again to locate the Batch processing entry (learning: must re-run State-Tool after clicking Mode).
Select 'Batch processing' to enable batch operations (per KB: set_mode_batch_processing).
Capture the UI in Batch processing mode to find controls for adding files or using File -> Open (required before interacting).

Open the File menu as an alternative to an 'Add files' button when that button may be absent (from KB: open_files). Past failures showed 'Add files' is sometimes not present so using File->Open is more reliable.
Capture the File menu to locate the Open command (always re-capture before the next click).
Invoke File -> Open to bring up the file selection dialog for adding multiple files in Batch mode (KB: open_files).
Capture the Open file dialog UI elements (required before typing the path or selecting files).

Enter the exact target folder path into the file dialog's filename/address field and press Enter to navigate there. Use the full folder path specified in the task (learning from open_files: must use exact folder).
Brief pause to allow the file dialog to navigate to the target folder and populate the file list.
Capture the file dialog now that the folder contents should be visible (required before selecting files).
Select one of the .MF4 files in the folder to enable subsequent 'select all' (learning from open_files: must select a file first before Ctrl+A).
Select all .MF4 files in the folder (after selecting one file first) so all will be opened for batch processing (KB: open_files).
Confirm the selection and open all the highlighted .MF4 files into Batch processing (learning: pressing Enter can be more reliable than clicking the Open button in some cases).
After loading files into Batch processing, capture the batch UI (file list and operation buttons) before starting the concatenate operation.

Choose the Concatenate operation to combine the selected files into one continuous measurement file (KB: batch_concatenate_files). If the UI shows multiple 'Concatenate' controls, the most appropriate one is the batch-operation Concatenate (learning: there can be multiple Concatenate buttons; ensure the batch-operation one is used).
Capture the Concatenate options dialog where the output filename can be entered (always re-capture before typing output name).
Enter the full output filename (in the same folder) into the Concatenate dialog's filename field so the concatenated result is saved at the required location (KB: batch_concatenate_files).
Start the concatenation by clicking Save (learning: the final action is Save rather than Start in this UI).
Wait for the concatenation to complete. Duration depends on file sizes; adjust if needed.
Capture final application state to confirm the operation completed or to reveal any error dialogs that require follow-up.
